title: My Python Journey Blog
description: Notes on learning Python, data engineering, and building things in public.

items.title: Adding Resilience with Tenacity – Retry Logic for HTTP Requests
items.content_html: After building a simple weather API client, the next step was making it resilient to transient failures. This post explains how I added retry logic with exponential backoff using tenacity, and what I learned about designing fault-tolerant systems.

items.title: Starting the PyBites PDM – from “can code” to “can build”
items.content_html: I'm developing an api client to get data from OpenWeather. This is more of a mind dump describing the process. I'm interested in explaining why the design decisions were made, justifying them and also considering alternative approaches.

items.title: Docker Deep(ish) Dive
items.content_html: I didn't just want to get images and run containers, I wanted to understand things a bit more for when it all goes wrong.

items.title: Starting the PyBites PDM – from “can code” to “can build”
items.content_html: First reflections on starting the PyBites Professional Developer Mindset and recognising the gap between writing working Python and building maintainable systems.

items.title: Setting Up a Production-Grade Python Project (From Scratch)
items.content_html: Notes on building a production-grade Python project from scratch, with an emphasis on tooling, quality gates, and repeatable workflows.
